title: Battle for 3rd: Pons-led FEU downs UST in four sets
content:
05:28 PM September 19th, 2015 

Recommended 

FEU moved a win a way from claiming third place in the Shakey’s V-League Season 12 Collegiate Conference Saturday. Tristan Tamayo/INQUIRER.net 

Far Eastern University gained headway in the best-of-three battle for third after downing University of Santo Tomas, 25-17, 25-17, 10-25, 25-20, Saturday in the Shakey’s V-League Season 12-Collegiate Conference at Filoil Flying V Arena in San Juan. 

Bernadette Pons walloped the opposition with 15 hits and one service ace while Jovelyn Gonzaga put up a defensive blockade at the net that proved good enough to foil the Tigresses from storming back and pushing the Lady Tamaraws to the edge.          

After zooming ahead in the first two sets, the Lady Tams fell complacent in the next frame, allowing the Tigresses to stage an onslaught through the collective efforts of Ennajie Laure, Carmela Tunay, Jessey De Leon, Marivic Meneses and Pam Lastimosa. 

Pons then took the initiative and conspired with Jovelyn Gonzaga, Honey Royce Tubino and Anne Guino-o to fend off a late charge by the Tigresses in the fourth and deciding set. 

Going for the clincher next Saturday, the Tams also squeezed the best out of Gonzaga, who had 11 hits and three blocks while Jerrilli Malabanan, Remy Palma, Basas, Guino-o and Royce combined for 32 hits. 

Laure and Lastimosa had 12 hits each during the one-hour and 40-minute match that saw Tunay, De Leon and Meneses assemble 20 points for the Tigresses. 

In the other game, Emilio Aguinaldo College also seized the headstart in its best-of-three series with National College of Business Administration, 25-18, 25-12, 25-14, in the Spikers’ Turf. 

Howard Mojica had 11 efficient attacks and one block in leading the Generals but his nine service aces dealt the most punishing blows to the Wildcats.

TAGS: Bernadette Pons, Carmela Tunay, EAC Generals, FEU, Howard Mojica, Jovelyn Gonzaga, NCBA, spikers’ turf, UST, V-League, Volleyball
